data.name: Voltron
data.author: Lyoko
data.description: Pendulum Monsters that can protect themselves by destroying their scales and a Deck that can OTK you if you don't respond quick enough.

data.name: Panda
data.author: Sock
data.description: A Beast Deck that relies on banishing to get the job done (and banishing their entire GY if they feel like it!).

data.name: Aria Fey
data.author: Sock
data.description: A fairy combo deck that revolves around making turn 1 Xyz Monsters supported by archetypal backrow and supporting tools to grind somewhat decently. Also can be used as an engine for fairy decks, featuring 0-3 Day and 0-3 Lune as a base.

data.name: Starships
data.author: Lyoko
data.description: A DARK Machine Synchro Deck that also utilizes 2 Normal Monsters for its combo plays.

data.name: Of the North
data.author: Redox
data.description: A banish-based Synchro and Link Deck that focuses on bringing out its big boss monster, Ranax.

data.name: Holifear
data.author: Mevs
data.description: A Deck that focuses on filling up the Spell & Trap Zones and using their monsters in said zones as material for different Summons.

data.name: Digitallias
data.author: Lyoko
data.description: Cyberse Union cards that Fusion Summon themselves into beatsticks among other things.

data.name: Rulers of Name
data.author: Ani
data.description: A very specific archetype that punishes cards for being part of an archetype.

data.name: Kuroshiro
data.author: Andraith
data.description: A Ritual-based archetype that loves to banish.

data.name: Goo-T
data.author: Lyoko
data.description: A Tribute-based Synchro Deck that Special Summons and interrupts the opponent.

data.name: Alchemaster
data.author: Andraith
data.description: A FIRE-based Synchro Deck that loves to Special Summon.

data.name: Daemon Engine
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A mill-based Deck that focuses primarily on OTK-ing the opponent.

data.name: Travelsha
data.author: Slinkiee
data.description: A truly innovative take on Ritual Monsters. Through Trap Cards, this archetype is able to pop off and pop cards.

data.name: Kyudo
data.author: Ani
data.description: A Warrior archetype that reveals their monsters in hand, activates effects and has an Xyz Monster to round it all out.

data.name: Chaos Performer
data.author: Novaksis
data.description: A grind archetype where your opponent decides how the game will play out.

data.name: Battletech
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A control the castle-esque Ritual strategy where you build up into a big boss monster and rain on the parade from there on out.

data.name: Faust
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A Trap Deck with 2 Normal Monsters and an incessant grind.

data.name: Kojoten
data.author: Ani
data.description: An archetype comprising of DARK Beast-Warrior monsters that can also inadvertently support other Beast-Warrior strategies.

data.name: Skafos
data.author: Ender
data.description: A hand-trap based Deck that loves Chain Links and has Infinitrack synergy.

data.name: Tacticore
data.author: Kiyousa Fujin
data.description: A Tribute-based strategy that focuses on controlling advantage and disrupting the opponent through a slew of Book of Moon-type effects.

data.name: Hydrovenal
data.author: Mevs
data.description: A Deck of WATER Pyro monsters that can banish monsters of specific Levels from the GY to Summon themselves from the hand or GY.

data.name: Karmasattva
data.author: Ani
data.description: An EARTH Psychic Deck that revolves around Tributing to get the job done.

data.name: Nadiupant
data.author: Sock
data.description: A grind archetype that builds up advantage, and while it doesn't disrupt your opponent proactively, it can protect itself quite well, and can be quite hard to deal with. Most of the interaction with this archetype lies in the Battle Phase, having a Negate Attack which bounces, a themed Wall of Disruption, and an Armades/Leviair tech Spell.

data.name: Chronotiger
data.author: Gus
data.description: A DARK Machine Xyz archetype with an... interesting theme, to say the least.

data.name: Koala
data.author: Sock
data.description: Building off of the existing "support" (Side Deck in above link), it's a Beast/Fusion/Flip archetype that benefits from the existing generic Beast and Fusion support. It usually operates under a heavy, multi-turn Beast lock (Watchful on field, Studious' effect).

data.name: Yurei
data.author: Sock
data.description: Part of a combined effort to introduce the new Type "Yokai", as well as the type-changing clause (This monster's original Type is treated as Yokai rather than TYPE.). A stun-oriented "protect the castle" archetype surrounded around bringing out an archetypal normal monster, and equipping it with archetypal monsters from the GY during the End Phase. Focusing on low-commitment plays, it is easily disrupted, both before and after executing their semi-linear combo. However, if left unhandled, the Yurei can punch through many boards.

data.name: Tsurumashi
data.author: Mevs
data.description: Part of a combined effort to introduce the new Type "Yokai", as well as the type-changing clause (This monster's original Type is treated as Yokai rather than TYPE.). A Ritual Control deck that aims to bring out 1 or both of its Rituals turn 1 maybe with a Set card or 2. It uses "Kami Tokens" to turbo out said Rituals, also it truly uses the GY as a resource for effects by shuffling them into the Deck. You will likely have little cards in hand at the end of the turn and you are fine with that.

data.name: Stars
data.author: Ani
data.description: A LIGHT Warrior Fusion Deck that also supports the Star/LIGHT Warrior theme.

data.name: Shirakashi
data.author: Ryck
data.description: With tricky banish effects based on the Shiranui, combined with the powerful Synchro toolbox of the Mayakashi, Shirakashi is a deck with several tricks up its sleeve and a formidable grind game.

data.name: Genjutsu
data.author: Gatr
data.description: Genjutsu is a monster-only Ritual Deck that uses Ritual monsters to Ritual Summon. They are a tempo-focused deck that excels at going 2nd and breaking boards, then out resourcing the opponent. Each Ritual has a removal effect on Summon, and the deck is capable of Summoning them as a Quick Effect.

data.name: Raycor
data.author: OceanPhantom
data.description: A Fusion-based Deck in a similar vein as Invoked.

data.name: Yova
data.author: Ani
data.description: A control-y Deck that revolves around trying to resolve Yova as many times as the Earth has revolved around the Sun, along with her support cards that also like to be used a bunch.

data.name: Armorizer
data.author: Dawn
data.description: A Deck focused around a singular monster, loading it with various effects via its Fusion Materials. Played pure it can feel very "protect the castle"-like.

data.name: Vampop☆Star
data.author: Faux
data.description: A Zombie Pendulum Deck that only Pendulum Summons from the GY. Although non-generic it can emphasizes on field preference in order to succeed.

data.name: The Parallel
data.author: Xccelerator
data.description: A small Link and Xyz package that focuses on getting in damage and doing some neat shenanigans.

data.name: Acrimonic
data.author: Ani
data.description: A Fusion Deck that does neat shenanigans with their combos.

data.name: Arsenal
data.author: Gus
data.description: A simple control WATER Cyberse Ritual Deck with good aggressive options that focus on popping stuff and profiting from it.

data.name: Mirror Force Archetype
data.author: FlavorFlov
data.description: Mirror Force made into an archetype! Each Main Deck monsters interact with their corresponding Mirror Force's inspired " Attribute", besides Infiltrator who supports all the Mirror Force Normal Traps. They also have a Battle Trap that Fusion Summons a Mirror Force Fusion Monster when your opponent declares an attack!

data.name: Armamemento
data.author: Dawn
data.description: A Warrior Deck with a spin, using Extra Deck monsters as equips.

data.name: Orisha
data.author: FlavorFlov
data.description: A Deck that's mostly centered around building big beaters to beat down your opponent. The better first turn boards apply pressure to your opponent's combo strategies. Their Fusion Spell gives them an edge against other WATER and Thunder based strategies, and the Fusion's deck out effects (usually milling 1 to 5 cards each) can apply a lot of pressure against mass milling strategies.

data.name: Thunderclap
data.author: Sock
data.description: A Thunder Deck that loves to Synchro, Link Summon and nuke the board.

data.name: Diabolition
data.author: Kiyousa Fujin
data.description: A Deck containing DARK Effect monsters and DARK Pendulum monsters that can destroy each other and themselves to gain effects and advantage. The Pendulum Monsters all share the same Pendulum effect of having protection against your opponent's destruction effects. Cleaver is the only one with an extra Pendulum Effect.

data.name: Wild Hunt
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A Synchro Deck based on The Witcher. The game plan is to make Caranthir alongside other soft disruptions, and work through his looping capabilities into Imlerith, then Eredin is your final gameplan. The Traps work to Special Summon a monster, or as an omni-negate at the cost of banishing 1 "Wild Hunt" monster from your hand or face-up field.

data.name: Meterao
data.author: Mevs
data.description: A Dinosaur-type Deck with effects based on Nibiru, the Primal Being, and Spells/Traps that are benefited by either player Special Summoning from the hand. It has a heavy reliance on the opponent.

data.name: Tagteamer
data.author: Anon
data.description: A control/beatdown Deck that is meant to be able to be sided into a completely different strategy anchored by one of the 2 Field Spells and a corresponding Link Monster.

data.name: Concept of Reality
data.author: Ani
data.description: A Normal Monster Deck that's actually not stun for once. Level 5 Machines of varying Attributes allow you to go into some pretty cool power plays.

data.name: Headhunter
data.author: Sock
data.description: A Pendulum control Deck focused around accumulating and managing "Head Counters" and using them for powerful disruptions.

data.name: Dark Arts
data.author: Matsu
data.description: A DARK based Deck that does Fusion, Synchro and Link stuff as well as discarding/banishing shenanigans.

data.name: Bucket Squad
data.author: FlavorFlov
data.description: A Fire Fighter themed archetype consisting of FIRE Aqua monsters in the main and FIRE Aqua and Machine monsters in the Extra Deck, mainly utilizing Link Monsters and sometimes Synchro Monsters. They're kind of similar to Salamangreat, except their main gimmick is that they do unfair things against other opposing FIRE centric strategies. They also somewhat support the "roid" archetype and use the card "Link Restart" as part of their main Link climb strategy.

data.name: Cosmic Primal
data.author: Matsu
data.description: A Pendulum Deck that uses different Spells, "Realms" to achieve different power plays, along with a Link and a Fusion Monster.

data.name: Submerzan
data.author: Gatr
data.description: This flip deck has a unique gimmick that makes it stand out from other flip decks: they have their own version of Shifting Shadows, and they use this to catch your opponent by surprise. If they activate an effect in the wrong column, or if they target the wrong monster, you can trigger the effects of your monsters.

data.name: Charismatic
data.author: Sock
data.description: A LIGHT Spellcaster based Link Deck.

data.name: Colossus
data.author: NoodleDoodle21
data.description: A control Deck that combines the styles of both True Draco and Eldlich.

data.name: Nekojishi
data.author: Gatr
data.description: Nekojishi mainly focuses on having Continuous Spells which apply passive effects to the monsters in their column.

data.name: Onion Slice
data.description: A going 2nd Warrior combo Deck that aims to get some specific monsters in the GY so they can banish themselves to Summon their Fusion counterparts.

data.name: Vengeful Tox
data.author: Sock
data.description: A DARK Yokai Fusion Deck that aims to build a Link-3 monster with an effect similar to Albaz and recur advantage with supporting cards.

data.name: Ookazi Archetype
data.author: Ani
data.description: It's an archetype... For Ookazi... Yeah I never thought I would see it either but here we are.

data.name: Giga Havoc
data.author: NoodleDoodle21
data.description: A Thunder Synchro Deck that focuses around monsters in the Spell/Trap Zones and destruction.

data.name: Final Dream
data.author: FlavorFlov
data.description: An engine archetype that supports Rank 4 Xyz Monsters, Number C/CXyz Xyz Monsters with added benefits and disadvantages for Zombie and Warrior Decks

data.name: P@rol
data.author: Ani
data.description: An archetype that relies on the opponent - in a similar vein as PSY-Frame.

data.name: Princess Connect!
data.author: TalosMistake
data.description: A Fusion-based Deck focused around excavating and Fusion Summoning with 1 Fusion Material.

data.name: Drakin
data.author: Ani
data.description: Normal Wyrm FIRE monsters that offer generic as well as in archetype effects and plays.

data.name: Plushmage
data.author: Mevs
data.description: A semi-generic lineup of Level/Rank 4 Spellcaster monsters that like to Xyz Summon and burn.

data.name: Queltz
data.author: Sock
data.description: A Ritual Deck that revolves around banishing cards, primarily from the top of the Deck face-down and controlling the board with Traps and a myriad of on-field effects which are fueled by the otherwise mandatory maintenance costs throughout the archetype, strongly encouraging a 60 card playstyle.

data.name: Moira
data.description: A Deck that revolves around a monster that Summons himself and 2 Tokens during your opponent's End Phase. The archetype has a Wobaku and a hand-trap to keep you alive, since the only monster you're going to ever be Summoning is Necrophobe who Summons himself at the end of your opponent's turn.

data.name: Dark Hole Archetype
data.author: Sock
data.description: A fine line between support and a standalone archetype, this pack of cards help support the Dark Hole strategy while also spicing things up with different unique effects.

data.name: Nebulline
data.author: AkeDragon
data.description: A Beast Deck that focuses on Xyz Summoning and modifying Levels, also featuring a new monster: Shin Chimera, Power.

data.name: Legendary Golems
data.author: Ryck
data.description: A Deck focused on surviving the first 5 turns of the Duel, then kicking it into high gear with a big boss.

data.name: Mekkallegiate
data.author: Ani
data.description: A Control Deck in a similar vein as Sky Striker - being adaptable, being able to take advantage of strong going 2nd cards and requiring somewhat specific setup to boot.

data.name: Masquerado
data.author: Diego
data.description: A very aggressive Spellcaster Tribute-based Deck that mainly wants to get out their beefy Level 10s, with the 7s added as flavor and 3 Level 4s that basically make the wheels spin.

data.name: Railreich
data.author: Rail, Unevenly Matched
data.description: An aggro column-based domino Deck that forces the opponent to make crucial decisions based on what's on the board.

data.name: Deus Ex
data.author: Ryck
data.description: A Deck similar in vein to Darklord but more focused around battling and EARTH Machine things.

data.name: Anglory
data.author: FlavorFlov
data.description: An EARTH Fish Pendulum archetype that relies on its Pendulum Summons and includes gimmicks like cleaning up either player's GY by banishing cards and floodgating Field Spell effects and Link-1 Link Monsters.

data.name: Witchwood
data.author: Cryselle
data.description: A mid-range Xyz & Synchro deck that utilizes banishing to generate board presence which it then converts into a host of toolbox options including negation, protection, extension, and removal.

data.name: Andromeda
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A Level 8 DARK Fiend Deck with a sole monster that exploits the DARK Spirit control play style to the max.

data.name: Dual Asset
data.author: NoodleDoodle21
data.description: An archetype revolving around giving the card 'Dual Assembwurm' support while also focusing on effects from being banished and keeping Dual Assembwurm on field to deal damage to your opponent.

data.name: Galaxieve
data.author: NoodleDoodle21
data.description: A Link and Xyz-based Deck focused around modulation of Levels and ranking up.

data.name: Owlsh
data.author: Sock
data.description: Taking inspiration from different effects of Konami made cards, these guys have their own unique effects, but with a twist.

data.name: Revived Beasts
data.author: Ryck
data.description: A Pokemon-themed Deck ultimately focused on bringing out its big Fusion Monster boss - Ho-Oh - Lord of the Revived Beasts. It's also pseudo-Fire King support.

data.name: Mechatech
data.author: Anon
data.description: A small high Level Machine/Dragon hybrid engine that has a unique Ritual Spell that Ritual Summons by fusing monsters with double the needed Levels.

data.name: Primal Forest
data.author: Anon
data.description: A bunch of gimmicks packed into a single Deck.

data.name: Bleakstory
data.author: Ava
data.description: A Link-based Deck that relies on Special Summoning and banishing face-down to get plays done.

data.name: Pendant
data.author: Sock
data.description: A very unique protect the castle-style stun Deck that utilizes their 1 monster with several Equip Cards to get the job done.

data.name: Rowa - Elusive Power
data.author: Sock
data.description: A Yokai control Deck boasting impressive consistency and good going second capabilities. Easily one of the most innovative and competent Spell/Trap control Decks in the server.

data.name: Taida
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A control Deck that revolves around counters. You Normal Summon the monsters which have decent stats and and try to use the Traps to grind your way through with the eventual win condition being to starve out your opponent then Summon the Rank 4 Xyz Monster.

data.name: Mythical Winged Beasts
data.author: Ghostricker
data.description: A Level 3 WIND Winged Beast control deck in a similar vein as Salamangreat. Currently maintained by Khreygond.

data.name: Dark Imp
data.description: A Level 3 burn Deck where all the Main Deck monsters are identical. The win condition is Achacha Warlord - he does the most burning. You don't usually end on any strong monsters apart from Warlord, but the Traps provide interruption and the Continuous Spells make the Deck have a grind.

data.name: Xiuhqui
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A Fusion Pendulum Deck that aims to first place Fusions from the face-down Extra Deck into the face-up Extra Deck, then place them into the scales. It grinds via Pendulum Summoning a single Main Deck monster and using its effect to Fusion Summon. It gets better over time, and all the Fusions can be quite disruptive.

data.name: Empyreal
data.author: Heavens Karma
data.description: An angelic grind Deck. The monsters gain extra effects if there are copies of them banished in your possession, and the Fusion Monsters can dodge a la Redoer.

data.name: NTG
data.author: FlavorFlov
data.description: A Gemini archetype with a lot of Traps and a grind.

data.name: Darkwater
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A DARK Aqua Pendulum beat down focused strategy.

data.name: Chronoruler
data.author: Anon
data.description: A Level 11 archetype based around the turn count and Spells/Traps that shuffle themselves while banished into the Deck.

data.name: Serpent Night
data.author: Ryck
data.description: A small Fusion engine revolving around Serpent Nightmare Dragon.

data.name: Wild Rose
data.description: A going second Warrior Equip Deck that buffs up a single monster, gives it a modicum of protection and tries to swing in for the kill.

data.name: Powerpuff
data.author: Ryck
data.description: A very versatile Level 4 Pendulum control Deck that focuses on making a big Synchro that can recur itself and banish cards from the opponent's GY, while resetting advantage and a Quick-Play targeted pop every turn.

data.name: Infrastructure
data.author: NoodleDoodle21
data.description: A Cyberse Pendulum combo Deck that utilizes Rank 7 Xyz Monsters.

data.name: Halvoran
data.author: Sock
data.description: A small WATER Beast archetype that revolves around banishing its monsters that also has a Continuous Spell.

data.name: Gesellschaft
data.author: Anon
data.description: A beat down protect the castle-type Deck based off Level 10 or higher monsters.

data.name: Tundran
data.author: Diego
data.description: A WATER Ritual OTK and hybrid Deck that can lock down your Deck and GY and shares similarities with Nekroz.

data.name: Frostyre
data.author: Andraith (formerly WIP)
data.description: A Ritual Deck that Tributes, battles and focuses on having no Spells/Traps in the GY.

data.name: GG (Galactic Gods)
data.author: Anon
data.description: Level 12 Chaos monsters that focus on changing the name, Type or Attribute of monsters on the field as a way of disruption.

data.name: Crystalion
data.author: Matsu
data.description: A Rock Deck with different Attributes focused on Summoning the Crystalion monsters using Gemalion monsters as their materials for getting effects by locking their so on so "opposites" in the process.

data.name: Wavering Winds
data.author: Faux
data.description: With light inspiration taken from Gusto and Mist Valley, Wavering Winds is a WIND-based Synchro combo strategy that utilizes their unique abilities to change control of WIND monsters on the field.

data.name: Malus
data.author: Ani
data.description: A Normal-based Deck that likes to banish and is also The Golden Apples support.

data.name: The Iterators
data.author: Sock
data.description: Sock's take on a series of Xyz Monsters akin to the Numbers. Please contact Sock#3222 if you wish to collaborate.

data.name: Intimidraco
data.author: FlavorFlov
data.description: A FIRE Dragon Deck focused on scaring your opponent, equipping Spells, modulating ATK and more.

data.name: Entropy Beast
data.author: Gatr
data.description: An archetype revolved around 1 Xyz Monster boss 'Entropy King Morte' that can attach materials from anywhere, including your opponent's cards.

data.name: Fishin'
data.author: OceanPhantom
data.description: An archetype revolving around Fishin' Fisherman, some Fish monsters and an array of Synchro Monsters, as well as a Link Monster.

data.name: Ak*ris
data.author: AkeDragon
data.description: A Pendulum archetype that uses many Extra Deck monster types, such as Fusion, Xyz, Synchro and Link to make disruptions.

data.name: Tokyo Terror
data.author: Redox
data.description: An archetype made in a similar vein to Eldlich but based off Hideaki Anno's hit movie 'Shin Godzilla', utilizing backrow and slowly evolving your monster into its ultimate form.

data.name: Bas-Yak
data.author: Sock
data.description: A Special Summon and resource management control Deck.

data.name: Contraption
data.author: Diego
data.description: A going second Machine Deck focused on outgrinding the opponent with Trap monsters, Fusion Monsters that can be Contact Fused and their Rank 5 toolbox - as well as decent turn 1 plays.

data.name: Mokey Mokey
data.author: Deus Vult
data.description: A relatively simple OTK Deck based on punching the opponent for huge damage that is also focused on the original Mokey Mokey gimmick of making 3000 ATK monsters to crush your opponent's monsters into the ground.

data.name: Doom Instruments
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A new take on an Xyz Deck - DARK Machine monsters that increase their Levels as Quick Effects, Xyz Summon DARK Machines using themselves and other monsters you control as material, send to recur resources and more.

data.name: Lemuria
data.author: Andraith
data.description: A WATER Synchro Deck focused around Special Summoning from the hand and effects during the Battle Phase.

data.name: Ugrovs
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A Yokai Deck focused on putting pressure on the opponent by using high Level Spirit monsters which the Deck can Tribute Summon as a Quick Effect to their advantage.

data.name: Primordial Driver
data.author: Sock
data.description: A stun Deck that utilizes minor disruptions, floodgates and monsters that can Normal Summon without Tributing, but at the cost of making their ATK 0, to their advantage.

data.name: Ancestagon
data.author: Dawn
data.description: A Dinosaur Pendulum archetype that takes advantage of Pendulum Summoning capabilities to summon powerful bosses - with an additional Tributing gimmick.

data.name: Stwyrmwind
data.author: Andraith
data.description: A WIND Pendulum archetype that uses discards, Spell monsters and Trap monsters and more to gain the upper advantage.

data.name: Bright Planet
data.author: Masha
data.description: A dice-based Xyz combo archetype where monsters are easily able to be Summoned and you roll the dice to determine what Level they become that's also versatile going first and second, with a Synchro in the mix to boot.

data.name: Sylphe
data.description: An unorthodox Fairy Pendulum flip archetype where the Pendulum Monsters add themselves to the Extra Deck face-up upon activation, providing setup for the boss monster.

data.name: Moonlit
data.author: Deus Vult
data.description: A heavy stun/control archetype based on shapeshifting - the titular "Moonlit" monsters "transform" into "Cursebound Lycanthrope" when a "Moonlight" Trap is activated in their column. In addition, the "Moonlight" Traps gain powerful second effects while you control "Cursed Lycanthrope", making them powerful blowout cards.

data.name: Darkest Power: Awor
data.author: Sock
data.description: A FLIP Yokai archetype based around the thematic antagonists to Rowa and company, having a gimmick where if you control any of its Traps, you can only control 1 Effect Monster, effects that activate when your opponent Summons from the hand and floating effects when sent to the GY by an opponent's card.

data.name: Abartech
data.author: Sock
data.description: A control Cyberse strategy with some Link-based elements to it.

data.name: Fiendfyre
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A Ritual OTK Chaos archetype that uses Fusion Monsters to ascend and win.

data.name: Mind Layer
data.author: AkeDragon
data.description: A Psychic Xyz archetype that revolves around banishing themselves for different effects, as well as utilizing Rank 3 Psychic Xyz Monsters and their arsenal of Level 3 monsters.

data.name: Carcharrack
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A WATER Aqua & Fish archetype revolving around the Carcharrack monsters, an army of shark boats that 'eat anything that moves' by banishing cards face-down - at the cost of not being able to Special Summon monsters from the Extra Deck. Their continuously resetting backrow cards allow them to keep up and eat their way to victory.

data.name: Armatos Legio
data.author: Andraith
data.description: A LIGHT Cyberse archetype focused around being linked, Link Summoning and attacking - and also being Lightning's Deck in the Yu-Gi-Oh! VRAINS anime.

data.name: Psycircuit
data.author: Anon
data.description: Gimmicky LV/RK5 Earth cyberse strat that is based around your your opponent revealing cards from their Extra Deck and specific counters.

data.name: The 9s
data.author: 9thV9CT0R
data.description: A combo-based Pendulum archetype featuring DARK Psychic monsters, banish plays and a solid Xyz Monster lineup.

data.name: Abyssal Enforcer
data.author: AkeDragon
data.description: A mainly FIRE-based Rock Synchro archetype that loves to battle.

data.name: Anti-Goo
data.author: Lyoko
data.description: A DARK-based archetype that is the opposite of Goo-T, denying Tributing as a result.

data.name: Nauticorpse
data.author: Kiyousa Fujin
data.description: A Ritual-based archetype consisting of WATER Zombie monsters whose strategy is to quickly bring out the boss monster, "Nauticorpse, Necrocaptain", with the use of cards such as "Nauticorpse, Necroneer" and "Nauticorpse Black Spot". The archetype then proceeds to banish as much of their cards as possible while giving more power to "Necrocaptain".

data.name: Solomons Studies
data.author: Sun
data.description: An extremely Spell heavy archetype with a playstyle that changes slightly depending on what Field Spell you have activated.

data.name: Pyrabbit
data.author: JustYourAverageJustin
data.description: A compact archetype based on tagging out during the opponent's turn to proc various minor interruptions.

data.name: Magistrophic
data.author: Squid
data.description: A Spellcaster archetype that Xyz Summons Xyz Monsters and uses them to contact fuse into Fusion Monsters. Each card deals with returning cards from the field to the hand while also aiming to Set 2-3 backrow cards and end on at least 1 Fusion Monster who gets certain effects based on the Xyz Monster(s) used for its Summon.

data.name: Khremysis
data.author: Diego
data.description: A Spellcaster archetype that Xyz Summons Xyz Monsters and uses them to contact fuse into Fusion Monsters. Each card deals with returning cards from the field to the hand while also aiming to Set 2-3 backrow cards and end on at least 1 Fusion Monster who gets certain effects based on the Xyz Monster(s) used for its Summon.

data.name: Tempo Warrior
data.author: Knightmare
data.description: A musical of a Synchro and Xyz archetype meant to mimic the idea of tempo. The pace increases during your turn as plays are made and damage is dealt, making the BPM go up, whereas on your opponent's turn, it slows down as you attempt to stop your opponent from playing and getting in for damage, making the BPM go down, with its supporting cards being based on other musical terms.

data.name: Stormrider
data.author: Andraith
data.description: A Link-based archetype revolving around the Spell & Trap Zones as well as being Windy's Deck from the Yu-Gi-Oh! VRAINS anime.

data.name: Stage Girl
data.author: TalosMistake
data.description: A Fusion-based multi-Attribute Warrior archetype that conducts Fusion Summons by returning listed Fusion Materials to the hand.

data.name: Simulacra
data.author: The Awkward One
data.description: A horror-themed archetype that relies on the eldritch creature known as the Simulacrum Core, a fiend that pulls the strings behind the curtain for its own malignant gain. Essentially, it's a control Deck that revolves around the Core and sets up interruptions through its various adaptations to slowly and gradually snowball for supremacy.

data.name: Vuluti
data.author: Sock
data.description: A toolbox-based Link-1 Deck that has semi-disruptive effects while in the Main Monster Zone as well as Main Deck monsters that have Quick Effects in the GY that trigger whenever they're targeted.

data.name: Devivain
data.author: Andraith
data.description: A FIRE Spellcaster and Fiend Ritual archetype that utilizes banishing and Trap Cards to win the game.

data.name: Nekker
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A Level 2 Beast archetype focused on battling, swarming and their main Xyz Monster: Nekker Chieftain.

data.name: Kitsento
data.author: Dawn
data.description: A FIRE and EARTH-based Beast-Warrior archetype that focuses on battling, but not in the 'one turn kill' sense - with an Xyz Monster boss to boot.

data.name: Attack on Titan
data.author: Black Hat
data.description: An EARTH, DARK and WIND-based Warrior archetype based around the popular anime 'Attack on Titan'. Utilizing Survey Corp monsters' effects to trade themselves out for a "Titan" monster, they play similarly to Dragonmaid, tagging out at useful increments - but at a cost.

data.name: Erwormwood
data.author: Sock
data.description: A grind-based WATER Spellcaster and Warrior control archetype that revolves around cards very similar to 'Jar of Greed' but with additional effects in the GY.

data.name: Magistar
data.author: Masha
data.description: A LIGHT Thunder archetype that revolves around Link Summoning and putting its Main Deck monsters in the Spell & Trap Zone for negates, high ATK and protection effects.

data.name: Thunderstrike Dragon
data.author: Knightmare
data.description: A WATER Thunder Pendulum beatdown archetype that utilizes monsters in the face-up Extra Deck as a resource loop and ultimately uses their big Fusion Monster for maximum plays.

data.name: The Aarp
data.author: Justin
data.description: A Rank 4 Spellcaster deck, that focuses on giving effects to the Xyz monsters that use it as material. Pretty simple engine that really shines if you manage to open multiples

data.name: Des Aspect
data.author: Ani
data.description: A DARK Fairy and Fiend archetype in a similar vein to Bujin but revolving around a single Ritual Monster.

data.name: Sisage
data.author: sizzler
data.description: A Spellcaster archetype with differentiating Levels that takes inspiration from the 'Spellbook' TCG archetype, with cards that specialize in searching other cards and Special Summoning monsters.

data.name: Ananta
data.author: Andraith
data.description: A DARK Reptile Fusion archetype that specializes in banishing, Fusion Summoning and being built around the TCG card 'Evil Dragon Ananta'.

data.name: Conqueror
data.author: Amaranthine
data.description: A Warrior and Spellcaster Fusion & Link archetype that focuses on Fusion and Link Summoning to build a board and deal damage.

data.name: Gaia's Chosen
data.author: Sock
data.description: An EARTH Spellcaster archetype inspired by Witchcrafter and Spellbook that focuses on activating Spells and gaining advantage.

data.name: Dusk Brigade
data.author: NoodleDoodle21
data.description: A DARK Warrior combo-based archetype with Synchro Monsters that aims to utilize face-down Defense Position monsters on the field to do plays, set up threatening boards and OTK.

data.name: Hotarugusa
data.author: TalosMistake
data.description: A LIGHT Plant Fusion archetype where all the Main Deck monsters have 2 different effects and the Fusion Monsters have interruption effects, as well as being able to recur or float into a LIGHT Plant monster.

data.name: Fireworks Girl
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A LIGHT Pyro combo archetype with a twist - each monster has a mandatory effect to search "Sparks" when they are Summoned.

data.name: Armourizer Series: Fleurcrux
data.author: Dawn
data.description: A multi-Attribute Warrior, Psychic and Wyrm Fusion archetype in a similar vein to Masked HERO.

data.name: Unbeing
data.author: Sun
data.description: A multi-Attribute Dinosaur strategy focused around Tributing their Normal Monsters to Summon the Effect Monsters as well as banishing cards from the hand to destroy your opponent's resources.

data.name: Xana
data.author: Lyoko
data.description: A DARK Cyberse archetype focused on quickly swarming the field while utilizing their different monster effects to hold onto the board.

data.name: Harokai
data.author: Diego
data.description: A versatile combo strategy that mainly revolves around stacking and matching Attributes to make their Rank 11 Xyz Monsters.

data.name: Superego
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A DARK Psychic Gemini archetype revolving around being able to Normal Summon the Main Deck monsters twice instead of just once after they have been Normal Summoned.

data.name: Ascending Fire
data.author: C.C.
data.description: A FIRE Thunder Pendulum OTK archetype that revolves around adding monsters to your face-up Extra Deck, swarming the field during the Battle Phase and getting in for game.

data.name: O.F.F
data.author: Draco
data.description: A Link and Xyz archetype revolving around placing Specter Counters and equipping.

data.name: Circersolar
data.author: AkeDragon
data.description: A multi-Attribute Aqua and Pyro Fusion combo/control archetype that focuses on Fusion Summoning boss monsters and utilizing backrow cards.

data.name: Draken
data.author: ShadowSlayer
data.description: A DARK Dragon archetype focused on Ritual Summoning, with monsters that when Tributed for a Ritual Summon equip themselves to a "Draken" Ritual Monster, giving said monster different effects in the process.

data.name: Metaverse Persona
data.author: Ryck
data.description: A protect the castle strategy focused on the iconic Joker character from the Persona franchise. Similar to Bujin and Tenyi, this archetype also employs usage of a Gemini mechanic for extra plays.

data.name: Pikachu
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A Thunder archetype in a similar vein to the TCG archetype 'Sky Striker', utilizing Link Monsters, Pendulum Monsters as well as a Fusion Monster.

data.name: Graal de Flamme
data.author: Gus
data.description: A FIRE Gemini Dragon and Warrior archetype that utilizes Fusion and Link Monsters, equipping from the hand and being based around the TCG archetype 'Infernoble Knight' - having synergy with them to boot.

data.name: Poppin
data.author: Ara
data.description: A LIGHT Aqua archetype focused on banishing and Link Summoning.

data.name: Boehstoic
data.author: Fallen
data.description: A control Fusion archetype inspired by the card 'Construction Train Signal Red', this Deck revolves around utilizing the Boehstoic monsters in the hand when the opponent attacks, which then redirects the attack and is consistent overall, with good grind to boot.

data.name: Mermaidol
data.author: Ryck
data.description: A Sea Serpent control deck that focuses on how cards "dance" between the hand and other locations. Its playstyle is heavily inspired by Trickstar and Marincess.

data.name: Jolsprit
data.author: Sock
data.description: A Fairy beatdown/protect the castle style archetype that revolves around equipping monsters from your hand while also having toolbox effects while equipped as well as being able to use the Level 1 toolbox.

data.name: Bolt Arc
data.author: Eureka
data.description: A Pendulum archetype comprised of the LIGHT Spellcaster "Bolt Arcanist" Tuners and the EARTH Thunder "Bolt Arcana" non-Tuner monsters, both of which have effects that activate only when Summoned to the Extra Monster Zone.

data.name: Spacial Demon
data.author: NoodleDoodle21
data.description: A Wyrm OTK archetype that combos by banishing its own cards.

data.name: Flutterbleu
data.author: Ava
data.description: A WATER Spellcaster archetype that lacks a singular gimmick but makes up for it with Ritual Monsters, Synchro Monsters and a Link Monster, along with having multiple ways to build strong boards.

data.name: Zeniphyr
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A WIND combo archetype revolving around Xyz Monsters that also double as Tuners, as well as having low Level Synchro Monsters.

data.name: Forge Breaker
data.author: Sock
data.description: An archetype which specializes in being able to make generic Link Monster plays, taking advantage of the cardpool at hand.

data.name: Imperialis
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A DARK Level 8 Fiend archetype with Traps that are able to be activated in the GY by banishing another Normal Trap from the GY, which in turn fuels the disruption of the other monsters, ultimately culminating in a Rank 8 boss monster that offers 2 search effects as well as recursion to speed the Deck up.

data.name: New Order
data.author: NoodleDoodle21
data.description: A Wyrm archetype with no Main Deck monsters, instead utilizing its own Spell and Trap Card lineup to Summon its Xyz Monsters.

data.name: Anguish
data.author: FlavorFlov
data.description: An archetype that expands upon the TCG cards 'Statue of Anguish Pattern' and 'Raging Earth' - utilizing Continuous Traps that become monsters and Extra Deck monsters that become Continuous Spells.

data.name: Mind Macabre
data.author: GodOfWhim
data.description: An archetype with a unique playstyle: Stealing your opponent's cards, engines and win conditions from their GY so you can play their cards better than they can.

data.name: Chirurgeon
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A mill archetype inspired mainly by Frankenstein that is capable of going first or second while utilizing milling as a timer rather than a primary win condition - along with a diverse variety of Spells.

data.name: E^rabastel
data.author: Fallen
data.description: A Ritual archetype that utlizes its Spells that are banished or in the GY in order to Ritual Summon from the GY while also relying on the value of the "Chapter" in the Spell's name, similar to how Galaxy Satellite Dragon uses the value of the "Number" in Number monsters' names - with a main gameplan being use the "Chapter" Continuous Spells in a manner akin to flipping through the pages of a book by sending "Chapter" Spells you control to the GY to swap them for a banished "Chapter" or to use their effects while also getting as many materials in the GY as possible to dig for going second cards to help break boards and get in for game.

data.name: Fossilrai
data.author: Xerex
data.description: An EARTH and WIND Dinosaur archetype focused on getting in battle damage with the help of their Synchro Monsters and turning the opponent's monsters to Defense Position for extra piercing damage.

data.name: DragoThief
data.author: Justin
data.description: An EARTH and WIND Dinosaur archetype focused on getting in battle damage with the help of their Synchro Monsters and turning the opponent's monsters to Defense Position for extra piercing damage.

data.name: Staysailor
data.author: Mevs
data.description: A LIGHT Plant archetype focused on resource loops and different control effects.

data.name: LaVoix
data.author: Sock
data.description: A Dragon Pendulum archetype that ignores Master Rule 4+ at the cost of not having a face-down Extra Deck.

data.name: Malevolessence
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A DARK archetype that plays almost exclusively from the banished pile and GY, essentially hoping to open the cards that can put archetype cards in the GY and then grinding with Malevolessence Fusion.

data.name: Cosmech
data.author: TheConstruct
data.description: A DARK archetype that plays almost exclusively from the banished pile and GY, essentially hoping to open the cards that can put archetype cards in the GY and then grinding with Malevolessence Fusion.

data.name: Varagon
data.author: Ajax
data.description: A DARK archetype that plays almost exclusively from the banished pile and GY, essentially hoping to open the cards that can put archetype cards in the GY and then grinding with Malevolessence Fusion.

data.name: Kuuroma
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A Trap-based archetype that mainly focuses on Attribute changing and having 6 generic Trap Cards that each interact with a monster of a specific Attribute.

data.name: Crystal Tower
data.description: An EARTH Fairy archetype that can equip monsters the opponent controls to different archetypal monsters by attacking into them and then unequipping them for powerful effects.

data.name: Chima
data.author: Gatr
data.description: An archetype based on 'LEGO: Legends of Chima' that features a fast-paced gameplan and focuses on Equip Spells and Fusion Monsters.

data.name: Panera
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A FIRE and WIND archetype that focuses on using FIRE and WIND monsters in a style similar to Chaos Decks, Setting cards and banishing cards.

data.name: DAWN and RUIN
data.author: Fizzyizzy & Meowly
data.description: A LIGHT and DARK Warrior Pendulum archetype that tags out with their Pendulum Scales, using the RUIN monsters as removal and DAWN monsters as utility.

data.name: Earth Guard League/Goranger
data.author: KettouRyuujin
data.description: An EARTH Warrior archetype that aims to swarm the field with all 5 of its archetypal monsters.

data.name: Mudafi
data.author: Sock
data.description: A Battle Phase oriented archetype with effects that activate in the hand at the start of the Battle Phase.

data.name: The Gashercore Collection
data.author: FlavorFlov
data.description: An archetype that works off the mechanics of the 'Metamorph' cards to create a control oriented play style, with Gasherfan monsters being able to transform into their Gashercore Fusion Monster counterparts in the process.

data.name: Inu
data.author: Sock
data.description: A WIND Beast archetype focused on 'Rooftop Inu', featuring equips for ATK and protection as well as being inspired by 'Trickstar'.

data.name: Shadow Whisperer
data.author: Fallen
data.description: A FIRE Pyro archetype that revolves around revealing cards in your hand in order to pull off different effects as well as a battle mechanic floodgate.

data.name: Wrasslin'
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A small archetype consisting of a pair of Fire/Ice Hand-esque Ritual and Fusion Monsters that cannot be destroyed by card effects and only float when they are destroyed by battle.

data.name: Cheezbeast
data.author: Gatr
data.description: A FIRE Fairy archetype that revolves around Cheese Counters and Synchro Monsters, as well as banish-based recursion.

data.name: Steelbrand
data.author: Ajax
data.description: An EARTH Machine Ritual archetype that Tributes and banishes Machine monsters.

data.name: Azur Lane
data.author: Knightmare
data.description: A Rank 9 WATER Machine deck which is flexible in its play style and has the ability to control the field with powerful on-summon removal and negation effects.

data.name: C.I.
data.author: Ajax
data.description: A reactive archetype that focuses on temporarily banishing its monsters as Quick Effects.

data.name: Penitent Wraith
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A Pendulum archetype comprised of Level 4 Zombie monsters that can remove cards the opponent controls or search/recur cards depending on where they are Summoned from.

data.name: Mechaneer's
data.author: TheConstruct
data.description: An EARTH Machine archetype that revolves around targeting its own monsters to trigger different effects, generate advantage and going into its boss monster to out-grind the opponent.

data.name: Ruined One
data.author: Gol Nazyn
data.description: A DARK Spellcaster archetype that utilizes the popular 'Exodia', 'Forbidden One' and its own 'Ruined One' cards to overwhelm the opponent by using the archetype's Xyz Monsters to fuel into each other and create an ultimate boss monster that is immune to various types of destruction.

data.name: Supermega
data.author: Knightmare
data.description: An EARTH Fish archetype in a similar vein to Superheavy Samurai, being able to discard themselves to get different effects and banish themselves from the GY as fodder for the Ritual Summon of the archetype's Ritual Monsters.

data.name: Conflagrant
data.author: Novaksis
data.description: A FIRE archetype that utilizes Chain Links to their advantage by putting certain effects on certain Chain Links to gain advantage.

data.name: Medaka
data.author: Ryck
data.description: An archetype focused around its Link Monsters, with the Main Deck monsters being able to Special Summon themselves from the hand.

data.name: Nordic Champion
data.author: BDSceptyr
data.description: A Warrior archetype that uses the Main Deck monsters in the hand as material for the Summon of their Synchro Monsters, allowing them to circumvent effects that would hamper them on the field, as well as banishing cards from the GY to unleash threats upon the opponent.

data.name: Alarkite
data.author: Justin
data.description: A FIRE Winged Beast archetype that uses Pendulum Monsters to grind and burn, with the ability to go off if the situation calls for it.

data.name: Nemesin
data.author: Khreygond
data.description: A rainbow Fiend archetype inspired by D/D/D's Dark Contract cards that has a primarily Trap control playstyle, but is also able to pivot to midrange or ramp as well.

data.name: Vendedda
data.author: Saffron
data.description: A diverse archetype that focuses on controlling the top card of your GY.

data.name: Dance of Swords
data.author: AkeDragon
data.description: A WATER Zombie archetype that focuses on Special Summoning from the hand and Synchro Summoning.
